page.title: 03Home Life-the TV's effects.
page.content: the most popular site. This allows the members of the family to separate and move to different rooms in order to watch the programme of their choice. This dispersal appears to have had three effects.It allows youngsters to watch relatively late into the night.The privacy allows them also to watch programmes on "unsuitable" topics. Thirdly, it increasingly means that families only come together in one room in order to view a programme of common interest or for special events such as meals or drinks. Where families do view together, it remains the adults who choose the programme.Adults watch from armchairs or settees but children tend to lie on the floor or have unusual seating arrangements such as bean-bags.
